title: notocactus
author: notocactus
content: We can see Bitcoin bullish trend over years with many types of chart: yearly highest price (max price), yearly mean price, yearly median price, yearly lowest price (min price).In my view, I see the Bitcoin Yearly Lowest Price can give us clearest view on Bitcoin bullish trend over years. It is very important to verify Bitcoin strength in hardest times that are reflected by Lowest Price each year.The trend is more bullish and has less up and down like with Yearly Highest (Max) Price chart.

comments.author: Negotiation
comments.body: My personal opinion is that Bitcoin is now recovering to move higher and it will increase in price further in the next few months. Since Bitcoin cannot go up continuously for a long time, it goes down a bit and then goes up again.Since Bitcoin has been fluctuating within a certain range for quite some time, we will have to wait a few more days to know about its upward trend.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Negotiation on March 09, 2025, 09:17:37 AMMy personal opinion is that Bitcoin is now recovering to move higher and it will increase in price further in the next few months. Since Bitcoin cannot go up continuously for a long time, it goes down a bit and then goes up again.Since Bitcoin has been fluctuating within a certain range for quite some time, we will have to wait a few more days to know about its upward trend.Bitcoin moves up more sustainably if you look at its Yearly Lowest Price chart, only a fluctuation between year 2021 and 2022, while for other years, the trend is upward smoothly.It's different with lot of ups and downs if you look at Bitcoin Yearly Highest Price. This chart looks to have pattern of cycle while the first chart is more parabolic.That's what I meant by plotting two charts attached in OP.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Hey OP, nice presentation... I have a small suggestion though if you don’t mind, can you put the comparative graph in just one image? That way, it’s easier to see the differences at a glance. Normally, when looking at graphs, we expect to compare at least two sets of data and having them in the same picture would make it much easier to analyze.

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: Since your presentation is about yearly lows, the 2025 data is not necessary for analysis to predict the yearly low and high this year. However, since you have already included it, and since I’m bullish this year and expecting another major Bitcoin bull run, my conservative prediction is that Bitcoin will hit $300K. If that happens, the yearly low of $78K (300k x 26 based on computation below) might already be in, meaning what we’ve seen this year could be the bottom.2024 - 108086 - high less 2024 38598 = total over high+ low = 26

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Good thread to put into perspective what we are talking about. I see a lot of pessimistic people on the forum but just as there have been throughout bitcoin's history when the price was going down. I still think, as freedomgo and Negotiation, that 2025 is going to be bullish.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Sanitough on March 09, 2025, 09:46:15 AMHey OP, nice presentation... I have a small suggestion though if you don’t mind, can you put the comparative graph in just one image? That way, it’s easier to see the differences at a glance. Normally, when looking at graphs, we expect to compare at least two sets of data and having them in the same picture would make it much easier to analyze.Yes I can, and here you go.  Quote from: freedomgo on March 09, 2025, 10:16:43 AMSince your presentation is about yearly lows, the 2025 data is not necessary for analysis to predict the yearly low and high this year. However, since you have already included it, and since I’m bullish this year and expecting another major Bitcoin bull run, my conservative prediction is that Bitcoin will hit $300KI know and we all know that 2025 year has not completed yet, and different people can think differently about Bitcoin trend and price within this year. Nobody know what are Highest and Lowest prices in 2025, before its last day.I only add 2025 year for a raw comparison but it's clearly that we will have better one on 1 January 2026 with full price data in 2025.Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on March 09, 2025, 10:32:03 AMGood thread to put into perspective what we are talking about. I see a lot of pessimistic people on the forum but just as there have been throughout bitcoin's history when the price was going down. I still think, as freedomgo and Negotiation, that 2025 is going to be bullish.I think so too but make sure you have your withdrawal plans if you don't plan to hold your bitcoin for one or two more cycles.Are you ready for the Bitcoin bull market? What's your plan? Some ideas for you

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Judging on the yearly lowest record. Bitcoin lowest price usually becomes lower to the previous low before it will record new lower low.So it means that the current is possible to stay there then next year will lower low or it can be this year.Nevertheless, it’s good to see that Bitcoin yearly low is increasing and most notably the previous high of Bitcoin. It means that once a resistance now turn into strong support. Nice thread.

comments.author: Macabury
comments.body: From the chart Bitcoin highs in 2024 and that of 3025 are almost on the same level. And the year after a significant event in the bitcoin space price of Bitcoin tend to suffer loss until another event takes place which is usually the bull run. There is no assurance of price recovering if we closely interpret this chart carefully without sentiments.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Quote from: notocactus on March 09, 2025, 02:13:13 PMQuote from: Sanitough on March 09, 2025, 09:46:15 AMHey OP, nice presentation... I have a small suggestion though if you don’t mind, can you put the comparative graph in just one image? That way, it’s easier to see the differences at a glance. Normally, when looking at graphs, we expect to compare at least two sets of data and having them in the same picture would make it much easier to analyze.Yes I can, and here you go.  Thanks, dude! Looks like you'll be updating your chart soon as Bitcoin is heading toward the bottom. As of this writing, BTC is trading around the $80K level, getting dangerously close to the yearly low. If this turns into a bear market, we might be stuck in it for a while, just like in previous cycles. I’m starting to worry that we won’t see a new ATH this year.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: notocactus on March 09, 2025, 09:03:13 AMWe can see Bitcoin bullish trend over years with many types of chart: yearly highest price (max price), yearly mean price, yearly median price, yearly lowest price (min price).In my view, I see the Bitcoin Yearly Lowest Price can give us clearest view on Bitcoin bullish trend over years. It is very important to verify Bitcoin strength in hardest times that are reflected by Lowest Price each year.The trend is more bullish and has less up and down like with Yearly Highest (Max) Price chart.I also understand this more better when it comes to having a long time investment plan to do, then it is mostly effective for us to consider, because we have not yet arrived at this year 2025 lowest of all time yet and same as high, but with the little we already have starting from the first day of the year to where we are now, it could also profit us if we could mildly go for a quarterly plan to be able to fit in on any of the above high and low for a market entry point especially when we get bearish, one can invest and speculate more before the market rises within a particular range.
